blog.name: thenoblehouseofdayne
blog.title: Just Another Game Of Thrones Nerd
blog.description:
Hello! I'm a Game of Thrones fanfiction blog! I am more familiar with the show, but if given enough information I can write for the books as well!

Requests Are Closed!

DRABBLES

MASTERLIST

title: Better Half 3 {Jon Snow x Twin!Reader}
body:
Warnings: sibling incest, argument, angst

Part One Here!

Part Two Here!

Ygritte had mused something cryptic about hunting before the weather turned, and disappeared shortly before dawn, leaving you and Jon with a moment of privacy, possibly your first in months. 

And yet, you could do little more than stare at each other, words as sparse as food beyond the wall. 

“Y/N,” It was a shock to hear your true-name and not the masculine alias you’d adopted since leaving Winterfell, “I know it isn’t perfect, but-”

“I’m cold,” you retorted, “and hungry, tired, and bruised. We can’t stay out here.” You crossed your arms, “I miss Winterfell, and my name, and my bed,” you sighed, shifting in front of the dwindling fire, “I miss you, Jon.”

Pain-registered on his face, and he drew a heavy breath, trying to fight the guilt that rose. 

“We ran away, and ended up worse off. This wasn’t what we thought it would be- if we go back… it has to be better than this.” Your voice broke off, and tears gathered on your lower lash-line, “this is agony.” 

“Do you want to leave?” He asked, his eyes dark and steeped in confusion, but never regret. 

“Not without you,” you were firm now, frustrated that he was still seeing some larger picture, one that grew fuzzier to you by the day, “I won’t leave without you.” 

He stood, his footsteps crunching in the snow as he closed the space between you, and kneeled in the snow at your feet, letting his eyes meet yours with an unknown intensity. “We could stay here,” he argued, taking your wrapped hand into his, “build a life outside the Wall. We don’t know what’s waiting for us over there, they could have told the Night’s Watch who we are, and what we did, and-” he blinked, lifting your hand to hold against his cheek, no matter the roughness of the hide-gloves against the frost-bitten skin, “I don’t want to lose you.” 

“And the Wildling?” You couldn’t deny how his words appealed to your heart, but you reason and contempt held you back from falling into his arms all together. “Will she be coming with us too?”

He sighed, as though he’d been caught in some lie. “I have feelings for her too, Y/N, but I don’t see why that matters-”

“You don’t?” You interrupted furiously, pulling your hand free. “Because it’s all I can think about! I ran away for you, I gave up my life to live by your side, I sacrificed my name for a life of being beaten and thrown out into the cold, and you want me to stomach the fact that you’re infatuated with her?” 

“I’m not-” he looked bewildered, and uncomfortable at having to express himself like a man on trial for a crime he hadn’t committed, only pondered, “I love you. Isn’t that enough?”

“Not anymore.” You turned your face away from him, ignoring how the tears stung as you bit them back. “Not when it’s only in words and not in deeds.” 

There was silence for a moment longer, and then the staggered exhale of breath like someone in shock. “Then, I’ll take you home. You’re right, you don’t belong out here.” 

A second set of footsteps approached, and Ygritte was confronted with the intense tension of the campsite. “Did someone die?” she chided, laying the two dead birds on the snow, warming her hands by the dying fire. 

“She wants to go home.” His voice was empty, devoid of the hurt he must’ve been feeling, if you’d bothered to meet his eyes. “We need to go south.”

Ygritte scoffed, and you could feel her eyes on you, examining the obvious weaknesses you’d exposed. “We can’t.” 

“I can.” You insisted, shifting your eyes from the dead fowl to the petulant redhead. “I’ll put on my old clothes and go back alone. I imagine you have much more pertinent things to do.” Your eyes moved to Jon now, angry when he wouldn’t meet your eyes, heart still aching in your chest. 

“I never asked you to leave,” he mumbled, his eyes still locked on the fire, his expression neutral and stone-like. “You’re doing this for yourself, don’t pretend like I’m forcing you away.” 

“Whoa,” she interrupted, slinging her bow over her shoulder. “We’re a long way from the Wall, and it isn’t a journey you’d want to make by yourself. You’re being rash, you need to think about this.” Concern, however veiled it was, laced her expression, “you can’t even hunt. Snow, why haven’t you talked her out of this?” 

“She’s more than grown,” he didn’t budge, “if she wants to run, let her.” 

You bit your tongue, nodding to yourself, and reaching for the pack at your side. “Goodbye, Jon.” 

He didn’t look up, and he didn’t respond. 

Eventually, the crackling of the fire was lost to the wind, the camp at your back, endless winter ahead, you began your long walk home.

Warnings: sibling incest, argument, angst

Part Two Here!

Ygritte scoffed, and you could feel her eyes on you, examining the obvious weaknesses you’d exposed. “We can’t.” 

“I can.” You insisted, shifting your eyes from the dead fowl to the petulant redhead. “I’ll put on my old clothes and go back alone. I imagine you have much more pertinent things to do.” Your eyes moved to Jon now, angry when he wouldn’t meet your eyes, heart still aching in your chest. 

“I never asked you to leave,” he mumbled, his eyes still locked on the fire, his expression neutral and stone-like. “You’re doing this for yourself, don’t pretend like I’m forcing you away.” 

“Whoa,” she interrupted, slinging her bow over her shoulder. “We’re a long way from the Wall, and it isn’t a journey you’d want to make by yourself. You’re being rash, you need to think about this.” Concern, however veiled it was, laced her expression, “you can’t even hunt. Snow, why haven’t you talked her out of this?” 

“She’s more than grown,” he didn’t budge, “if she wants to run, let her.” 

You bit your tongue, nodding to yourself, and reaching for the pack at your side. “Goodbye, Jon.” 

He didn’t look up, and he didn’t respond. 

Eventually, the crackling of the fire was lost to the wind, the camp at your back, endless winter ahead, you began your long walk home.

blog.name: the-girl-in-the-high-castle
blog.title: Lot's Wife
blog.description: 24. Anthropologist. I want to meet someone that makes me feel the way music does. History nerd and eternaly suffering from Anemoia. I sold my soul to The Man In The High Castle, Brian Fallon, Brandon Flowers and Tom Smith. Eternal love for Babylon Berlin and Halt and Catch Fire. Always in discussion mod for A Song of Ice and Fire and The Wheel of Time.                                                                             "I've always dreamed of classic cars and movie screens."

blog.name: crying-over-spilled-feels
blog.title: Crying Over Spilled Feels (A Fanfiction Blog)
blog.description: FanFiction Imagine, Request, Headcanon, and Review Blog for countless fandoms. I will also do series/movie reviews as well as song recommendations and writing prompts. She/Her pronouns. Female. Age:19

tags: not a request but I had the idea while watching an episode
and because Jon and Arya are two of my favorite characters
best friends and partners in crime
summary: When the Student Surpasses Her Master
title: When the Student Surpasses Her Master
body:
Disclaimer: I do not own any of the canon characters; they belong to George R.R. Martin and HBO. This is most likely an AU fic, as I’ve just begun watching Game of Thrones for the first time, so I’m only on Season Two. No spoilers, please! Also, when I refer to ‘adulthood’, I mean around 16 or so since that was typically when most young women were married at the time. 

 

           After what seems like decades spent away from his family, Jon Snow returns home for a brief visit to Winterfell. In actuality, the illegitimate son of Lord Eddard Stark had only been away a maximum of three years. However, in that time, so much has changed the landscape he was lucky enough to call ‘home’ in his youth. For one, Robb has become the King in the North after the war against the Lannisters, bringing great honor and pride to the Stark family and the whole of Winterfell. Sansa, Arya, and Bran have all made it safely into adulthood with Rickon not far from joining them. It seemed to be entirely true that the Starks are hard to kill, as Jon told Robb before leaving for the Wall. Breathing in the scents of home, Jon strides into the castle’s courtyard with Ghost obediently trotting alongside his master.

           Due to his distraction at seeing home again, Jon barely sees the point of a blade aimed at his muscular chest.

“Hello, Jon,” Arya smiles, gently tapping Needle against her half-brother’s chest. “Did you miss me?” she inquires, standing side-face as Jon pulls out his own blade.

“Of course I did, Arya,” Jon grins, striking his sword against Arya’s and relishing in the large metallic clang it produces. “I see your skill has improved remarkably, my sister,” he compliments before smirking. “But, you’re still not skilled enough to best me, I’m afraid,” the young man laughs as he teases Arya.

The youngest Stark daughter quickly disarms her older, stronger brother.

“How in the Seven Kingdoms did you do that?!”

“Perhaps I just like proving you wrong,” Arya cheekily grins. “I do believe the student has surpassed the master, Jon,” she laughs, earning her a light shove.

Author’s Note: Okay, so I had never watched Game of Thrones before this year because I was not old enough to watch such a mature show, but I bought all completed seven seasons and recorded Season Eight to watch as a present to myself for my 19th birthday in May. I am only on Episode 7 of Season Two, so please do not give me any spoilers as to how the show actually ends. I will watch more episodes whenever I get the chance, but right now I’m having to work around 43 hours outside in the heat all day because about two of my co-workers quit and two others are on vacation for a few days. Expect more Game of Thrones fics from me both here and on my FanFiction account, which you can find by searching ‘Outsiders Obsessor FanFiction’  on Google if you’re interested. If you have any non-spoiler requests, please let me know! Reviews, as always, are greatly appreciated as long as they contain no spoilers. Until next time, dear readers! Have an amazing day, afternoon, or night!

summary: The amount of sheer stupidity shown by Game of Thrones creators who thought that they could show us 'cool special effects' and...
body: The amount of sheer stupidity shown by Game of Thrones creators who thought that they could show us ‘cool special effects’ and be done with us seems only to be increasing when you realise that the show originally didn’t have a lot of budget and that’s when it became so crazy popular.

reblog.comment: The amount of sheer stupidity shown by Game of Thrones creators who thought that they could show us ‘cool special effects’ and be done with us seems only to be increasing when you realise that the show originally didn’t have a lot of budget and that’s when it became so crazy popular.

trail.content: The amount of sheer stupidity shown by Game of Thrones creators who thought that they could show us ‘cool special effects’ and be done with us seems only to be increasing when you realise that the show originally didn’t have a lot of budget and that’s when it became so crazy popular.

summary: Manager: I'm afraid there's been a mistake, lady Stark. We have you and your brother booked in the same room, with only one...
body:
Manager: I’m afraid there’s been a mistake, lady Stark. We have you and your brother booked in the same room, with only one bed.

Sansa: There’s no mistake. Jon sleeps in the tub.

blog.name: waking-dreams-of-harmony
blog.title: Headcanon is the new reality...
blog.description:
Hi there! My name is Ellie! Welcome to my tumblr!  Just thought I'd add a few things to know about me and my blog! If my url gives you any clues, at the heart of this tumblr, I'm a proud Harmony shipper through and through. And while I do still reblog HHR and Dan and Emma content (and I always will) you will find that the majority of my focus has shifted to Jonerys (Jon x Daenerys from Game of Thrones). And while you might have to do a little deep blogging to find my reblogs on these, I also ship--both passionately and casually--Cesare x Lucrezia, Mulder x Scully, Lizzington for a while until tptb started to mess with it, Baker x Lawson (Bawson), all the Sense8 ships though Kalagang is my #1, Clint x Natasha (Clintasha), Jane x Thor (Fosterson), Darcy x Loki (Tasertricks), Darcy x Steve (Shieldshock), Kili x Tauriel (Kiliel), Superman x Wonder Woman (Superwonder), and more than I have space for or the memory to list. 
I do my best to tag every post so that if something is your notp, it's nsfw, or it's triggering, you can blacklist it. That said, if you follow me and there is something that you need tagged in order to make it a happy place for you to explore, come into my inbox and let me know :) You will also see a lot of politically charged reblogs in support of women, the queer/gender-queer and trans community, BLM, Muslims, POC, Jewish people, the mentally ill, and austistic people. I'm strongly pro choice, pro inter-sectional feminism, and refuse to call the angry cheeto currently living in the white house president. If anything like that offends you, this might not be the right blog for you.
Last little few things to throw out there: I'm 35, I plan to adopt at least 4 cats (or more) at some point and be that cat lady everyone's always whispering about, and I tend to greet and converse with everyone I meet like an overeager puppy. 
Whew! Sorry for the long intro folks! Please enjoy your time here, and remember, you're always welcome to come in and say hi!

blog.name: kirstenseas
blog.title: Kirsten
blog.description: 36. Slytherin. Non-binary. Sexuality tbc. Eclectic tastes. BOFQ. Serial bookmarker on AO3. Probably an ex-writer. Still basically a left-leaning 90s teenage hippy. Different points of view accepted, mistakes encouraged. Talk rational to me, baby, and we’ll get along great. 🇬🇧🇪🇺
